snippet: Rooftop farms in some of the world's most crowded cities, including Hong Kong, New York and Tokyo, are adding a bit of green to the gray. They are reconnecting city dwellers with nature, teaching consumers about homegrown food and offering a glimpse,...
abstract: Rooftop farms in some of the world's most crowded cities, including Hong Kong, New York and Tokyo, are adding a bit of green to the gray. They are reconnecting city dwellers with nature, teaching consumers about homegrown food and offering a glimpse, perhaps, of a more secure and sustainable food supply.

headline.main: Up on the Roof, a Real-Life Farmville
